A Growing Cult of Millennials Is Obsessed With Early Retirement. This 72-Year-Old Is Their Unlikely Inspiration

content.html:
@cassey I think the change is actually in the way keyword arguments are handled? If you call CSV.generate(**options) it works without needing to check whether the hash is empty because the ** operator explicitly tells ruby that the options parameter contains keyword arguments and not a positional argument. cf https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2019/12/12/separation-of-positional-and-keyword-arguments-in-ruby-3-0/

Separation of positional and keyword arguments in Ruby 3.0
content.text:
@cassey I think the change is actually in the way keyword arguments are handled?  If you call CSV.generate(**options) it works without needing to check whether the hash is empty because the ** operator explicitly tells ruby that the options parameter contains keyword arguments and not a positional argument. cf https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2019/12/12/separation-of-positional-and-keyword-arguments-in-ruby-3-0/
Separation of positional and keyword arguments in Ruby 3.0
